Issues.Title: Error using `@angular/common/http` and `@angular/router`
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common, router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Since version 14.2.0 we are having problems with testing our component library.
Our tests can no longer find the services using configureTestSuit as shown in the example:
```typescript
configureTestSuite(() => {
    TestBed.configureTestingModule({
      imports: [HttpClientTestingModule],
      ...
    });
  });
```

Our component [library](https://po-ui.io/) is always updated, as a new version of Angular comes out, and we noticed this today when we were going to generate a new package we noticed the errors, and we did a regression test and we saw that in the previous version 14.1.3 the error did not happen.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(DynamicTestModule)[ActivatedRoute -> ActivatedRoute]:
          NullInjectorError: No provider for ActivatedRoute!
        error properties: Object({ ngTempTokenPath: null, ngTokenPath: [ 'ActivatedRoute', 'ActivatedRoute' ] })
        NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(DynamicTestModule)[ActivatedRoute -> ActivatedRoute]:
          NullInjectorError: No provider for ActivatedRoute!

============================== AND ==============================

NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(DynamicTestModule)[HttpClient -> HttpClient]:
          NullInjectorError: No provider for HttpClient!
        error properties: Object({ ngTempTokenPath: null, ngTokenPath: [ 'HttpClient', 'HttpClient' ] })
        NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(DynamicTestModule)[HttpClient -> HttpClient]:
          NullInjectorError: No provider for HttpClient!
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 14.2.1
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.15.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 14.2.0
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1402.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.2.1
@angular-devkit/core            13.3.9
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.3.9
@angular/cli                    14.2.1
@schematics/angular             13.3.9
ng-packagr                      14.2.0
rxjs                            7.5.6
typescript                      4.8.2
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Error using `@angular/common/http` and `@angular/router`" (#47291)

Issues.Title: Additional Observables for `AbstractControl`: `value$`, `dirty$`, `invalid$`, ...
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

Hey all, great work on the typed reactive-forms üëè 
Currently, the `AbstractControl` offers `valueChanges` and `statusChanges` as observables that emit whenever the value of the control changes. While this is great for certain use cases, many RxJS use cases require us to consume the control state reactively.

While working with NgRx, RxJS and Angular, we often still need "regular" observables, which automatically replay the latest state, whenever you subscribe to them. Additionally a lot of developers are searching for ways to bind to variables like `dirty`,  `invalid` reactively.

We were previously using the [`ngneat/reactive-forms`](https://github.com/ngneat/reactive-forms) which offered a great developer experience, by providing these additional observables to ease our lives.

I'd be very happy to **contribute a solution** that simply operates on top of the existing `valueChanges` and `statusChanges` to make the API of the `AbstractControl` more accessible.

### Proposed solution

Addition of cold observables, which replay the latest value, whenever they are subscribed to:
- `value$` Similar to `valueChanges` but emits on subscription the latest value.
- `dirty$`:  Mirrors the dirty getter as an observable.
- `pristine$`: Mirrors the pristine getter as an observable.
- `touched$`:  Mirrors the dirty getter as an observable.
- `untouched$`: Mirrors the pristine getter as an observable.
- `enabled$`: Mirrors the enabled getter as an observable.
- `disabled$`: Mirrors the disabled getter as an observable.
- `valid$`:  Mirrors the dirty getter as an observable.
- `invalid$`: Mirrors the pristine getter as an observable.

### Alternatives considered

Every dev can write their own set of helper functions to reactively select attributes from the `AbstractControl`:

[Example App](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-mwxdxl?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts,src%2Findex.html)
```ts
export function selectFormValue<Value, RawValue extends Value>(
  control: AbstractControl<Value, RawValue>
): Observable<Value> {
  return defer(() => control.valueChanges.pipe(startWith(control.value)));
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Additional Observables for `AbstractControl`: `value$`, `dirty$`, `invalid$`, ..." (#47289)

Issues.Title: Reopen #27936 - Resolved data from parent is not available in child resolver
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

Original issue: #27936

When there are 2 routes: child and parent, each has a resolved property, the data form the parent resolve is not available in child resolver (still available in ChildComponent though as expected)

[Original Angular v6 repro](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-7xwxls?file=src%2Findex.html)
[Actual Angualr v14 repro](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-4hynrm?file=src/app/app.module.ts)


### Proposed solution

`data` parameter of `route` should follow `paramsInheritanceStrategy`

### Alternatives considered

The resolve data from the parent can still be accessed as
```
class ChildResolver {
  resolve(route) {
    const parentData = route.parent.data;
    // ...
  }
```
but this looks like a hack
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Reopen #27936 - Resolved data from parent is not available in child resolver " (#47287)

Issues.Title: build(bazel): Fix a bug where the aio build artifact didn't include assets
Issues.Body:
@devversion @josephperrott @gregmagolan 

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [x] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

The aio build target under bazel doesn't produce an artifact containing assets because the generated assets referenced in angular.json can't be found under the exec root. Either I need to add asset entries to angular.json pointing to the output dirs on each platform, or I just run the build target inside the output tree like I did here.

The test and serve targets do not have this issue because the generatednassets in the output tree are copied to the correct relative path in runfiles.

## What is the new behavior?

The build artifact now contains the assets.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build(bazel): Fix a bug where the aio build artifact didn't include assets" (#47286)

Issues.Title: fix(animations): make sure that the animation function delay is applied
Issues.Body:
make sure that when an animation is defined via the `animation` function
(and used via `useAnimation`) and a delay has been provided then that
delay gets correctly applied

resolves #47283

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

Issue Number: #47283

As you can see from the stackblitz in the issue, the delay of animations defined using `animation` is not correctly applied:

![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/187098211-a7a1e0d1-cb96-48e6-a253-d59ceff3e9a8.gif)

## What is the new behavior?

The delay gets correctly applied:

![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/187098226-d5877408-bd5c-49b0-a911-d60514658860.gif)


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
 - `useAnimation` can also take a delay option, and that is also not being applied, I haven't dealt with that in this PR, if ok I thought of looking into it in a follow up PR
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(animations): make sure that the animation function delay is applied" (#47285)

Issues.Title: Animation skips state transition triggered by RouterOutlet deactivate=>activate
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

animations, router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Not sure if a feature request or a bug.
If you change the value of the property bound to an animation trigger using `activate` and `deactivate` `RouterOutlet`'s outputs, on route navigations where `deactivate` is immediately followed by an `activate` event, the first state change `whatever=>deactivated` gets ignored by animation.
I suppose it's due to the async nature of the trigger. 
In fact turning the outputs property assignments into async makes things work as expected (at least by me).

You can see it in the provided stackblitz

1.  If you let uncommented the sync router-outlet implementation:

-   at first routing you get the correct transition recognized
```
Property changed to: rendered

State transitioned: cleared->rendered
```
- at exiting routing you get correct transition again
```
Property changed to: cleared

State transitioned: rendered->cleared
```
- but at routing between children, when `activate` follows `deactivate`, transitions get ignored, because seen as `rendered=>rendered`, skipping the middle `cleared`
```
Property changed to: cleared

Property changed to: rendered
```
2. Things works as they should (IMHO) if you comment out the sync router-outlet, and use the one leveraging async assignment on outputs:
this is what you get on routing between children
```
Property changed to: cleared

State transitioned: rendered->cleared

Property changed to: rendered

State transitioned: cleared->rendered
```
I find always "lame" having to resort to setTimeout and similar tricks to turn async something that is not, working in a reactive framework.
So I was wondering if those outputs implementation should be reconsidered.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-ts-strict-enabled-nudgw7?file=src/app/app.component.html

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Animation skips state transition triggered by RouterOutlet deactivate=>activate" (#47284)

Issues.Title: Delay option ignored in animation function
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

animations

### Is this a regression?

No (at least I don't think it is)

### Description

The [animation](https://angular.io/api/animations/animation) function accepts a `delay` option which should delay the animation, but the option seems to be ignored (there are no errors thrown/displayed, the option simply doesn't produce any effect).

You can see the issue in this [stackblitz reproduction](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-mtumzm), there if the `delay` is provided via the [transition](https://angular.io/api/animations/transition) function then the animation works as expected, but it does not when the `delay` is provided via  [animation](https://angular.io/api/animations/animation).

![Peek 2022-08-28 12-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61631103/187072826-df9e6735-4c62-4309-9e8f-3bbe28b3e47c.gif)

Note: The [useAnimation](https://angular.io/api/animations/useAnimation) function seems to present the same exact issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Delay option ignored in animation function" (#47283)

Issues.Title: Extended ngClass array syntax (allow strings and literals)
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

Currently, the `[ngClass]` syntax is limited to only strings or only literals. When both are provided (using two separate `[ngClass]` inputs - one with strings, the other with literal) - only one is rendered. In order to mix the incoming values, dev has to use some sort of ts helper that produces the literal.


### Proposed solution

I would propose that Angular adopt a new array-based syntax for `[ngClass]`. The [`NgClassSupportedTypes`](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/common/src/directives/ng_class.ts#L10) union would be extended by:

`Array<string | Record<string, boolean | undefined | null>>`

In practice, dev would be able to provide an array of strings mixed with literals, depending on how a given css class is provided. Usage example:

`[ngClass]="['fixed-class', input1, input2, {'flagged1': bool1, 'flagged2': bool2}, input3$ | async]"`

I think this syntax would reduce the code that today has to be handled by the TypeScript code (via getters, methods, HostBindings and whatnot), or get scattered over html and ts, thus making the code verbose and hardly manageable.


### Alternatives considered

As mentioned, yes, certainly, workarounds exist, but they essentially produce overcomplicated and hardly maintainable code. The proposed syntax would consolidate css classes into one expression and move it close to the html element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Extended ngClass array syntax (allow strings and literals)" (#47279)

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler): replace most usages of getMutableClone (#47167)
Issues.Body:
This is a cherry-pick of #47167 into the patch branch.

Replaces (almost) all of the usages of the deprecated `getMutableClone` function from TypeScript which has started to log deprecation warnings in version 4.8 and will likely be removed in version 5.0. The one place we have left is in the default import handling of ngtsc which will be more difficult to remove.

PR Close #47167
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(compiler): replace most usages of getMutableClone (#47167)" (#47271)

Issues.Title: Reload page with router + standalone components will not show the right component
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Currrently my webapp has the version angular 14.1.0 and everything works correctly.
My webapp uses the Standalone components with the router.

After upgrade to 14.1.3 or 14.2.0 I have the problem, if I reload the page the router will not show the correct component.
Only if I navigate in my header-component with routerLink-Directive it works.
But if I reload the full application with the refresh button in the browser, it doesn't work since Angular 14.1.3. Then my router-outlet is empty.

This is my bootstrapApplication-call:

```
bootstrapApplication(AppComponent, {
    providers: [
        importProvidersFrom(
            RouterModule.forRoot(routes, {
                scrollPositionRestoration: 'enabled',
            })
        ),
        importProvidersFrom(HttpClientModule),
        importProvidersFrom(
            HttpClientXsrfModule.withOptions({
                cookieName: 'csrf_token',
                headerName: 'X-CSRF-TOKEN',
            })
        ),
        { provide: Window, useValue: window },
    ],
}).catch((err) => console.error(err));
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
I dont see any exceptions or errors in the logs at all.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

_No response_

### Anything else?

Angular CLI 14.1.3
or
Angular CLI 14.2.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Reload page with router + standalone components will not show the right component" (#47273)

Issues.Title: Navigating to url with "/:pathVariable" with null unicode symbols causes History.PushState error on route change
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? router ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Navigating w/ path matched variables with weird/odd unicode input cause a `History.pushState` exception. - Define a route that has a path-matched param ``` { path: 'home/:id', component: HomeViewComponent }, ``` - Navigate to that path with a very weird Unicode param containing unicode nulls `\u0000` ``` Break me ``` - Boom, Error! ``` ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): SecurityError: Failed to execute 'pushState' on 'History': A history state object with URL 'https://angular-router-basic-example-w9ecym.stackblitz.io/home/%00%00d%00%00%00%00Q%00%00%00%00' cannot be created in a document with origin 'https://angular-router-basic-example-w9ecym.stackblitz.io' and URL 'https://angular-router-basic-example-w9ecym.stackblitz.io/login'. Error: Failed to execute 'pushState' on 'History': A history state object with URL 'https://angular-router-basic-example-w9ecym.stackblitz.io/home/%00%00d%00%00%00%00Q%00%00%00%00' cannot be created in a document with origin 'https://angular-router-basic-example-w9ecym.stackblitz.io' and URL 'https://angular-router-basic-example-w9ecym.stackblitz.io/login'. at history.pushState (preview-d88182ac6931a.js:2:16857) at BrowserPlatformLocation.pushState (browser_platform_location.ts:92:1) at PathLocationStrategy.pushState (path_location_strategy.ts:92:1) at Location.go (location.ts:107:1) at eval (router.ts:727:37) at SafeSubscriber.eval [as _next] (Observable.ts:267:11) at SafeSubscriber.__tryOrSetError (Subscriber.ts:263:10) at SafeSubscriber.next (Subscriber.ts:205:23) at Subscriber._next (Subscriber.ts:135:22) at Subscriber.next (Subscriber.ts:95:12) at resolvePromise (zone.js:770:31) at resolvePromise (zone.js:741:17) at eval (zone.js:818:17) at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:424:31) at Object.onInvokeTask (ng_zone.ts:288:1) at ZoneDelegate.invokeTask (zone.js:423:36) at Zone.runTask (zone.js:191:47) at drainMicroTaskQueue (zone.js:584:35) at ZoneTask.invoke (zone.js:490:25) ``` Note, you can dupe this on any webpage, by doing: ``` history.pushState('blah', 'blah', '\u0000\u0000d)\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000Q\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000'); ``` ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-router-basic-example-e7nmkh ### Please provide the exception or error you saw _No response_ ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Google Internal ref: b/239974353 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navigating to url with "/:pathVariable" with null unicode symbols causes History.PushState error on route change" (#47264)

Issues.Title: fix(service-worker): only consider GET requests as navigation requests
Issues.Body:
Previously, the criteria for determining if a request was a [navigation request][1] did not account for the request method. This incorrectly identified HTML form submit POST requests as navigation requests and served `index.html` instead of passing them through to the server, thus breaking the form submission.

This commit fixes this by ensuring that only GET requests are considered navigation requests.

> **Note**
> HTML forms with their method set to `GET` will still be affected by the issue. This is not a big concern, because using `GET` for form submission is quite uncommon and generally discouraged (due to limitations and security considerations).

##
Fixes #36368.

[1]: https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-config#handling-navigation-requests
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(service-worker): only consider GET requests as navigation requests" (#47263)

Issues.Body: Fixes #41931.

Issues.Title: `browser-esbuild` unable to import scss files
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When I build the Angular application that uses scss and import scss files in `styles.scss` with `browser-esbuild`, I get error ``` ‚úò [ERROR] [plugin angular-sass] Can't find stylesheet to import. ``` I did try to add root path to **angular.json** file, still saw the same error ``` "stylePreprocessorOptions": { "includePaths": [""] }, ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Clone the repo https://github.com/pavankjadda/angular-cli-esbuild-bug 2. Run command `ng build` ## üî• Exception or Error 

‚úò [ERROR] [plugin angular-sass] Can't find stylesheet to import.
  ‚ï∑
2 ‚îÇ @import '~bootstrap/scss/bootstrap.scss';
  ‚îÇ         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  ‚ïµ
  src/styles.scss 2:9  root stylesheet

    angular:style/global;styles:1:8:
      1 ‚îÇ @import 'src/styles.scss';
        ‚ïµ         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 14.2.1
Node: 18.8.0 (Unsupported)
Package Manager: npm 8.18.0 
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 14.2.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1402.1
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.2.1
@angular-devkit/core            14.2.1
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.2.1
@angular/cli                    14.2.1
@schematics/angular             14.2.1
rxjs                            7.5.6
typescript                      4.7.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`browser-esbuild` unable to import scss files" (#23815)

Issues.Title: Build not working correctly with CompressionWebpackPlugin and property 'deleteOriginalAssets'
Issues.Body: # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular 11 ### Description After updating Angular from version 11 to 14, the build no longer works correctly. The scripts tag (for runtime, polyfills and main) in the index.html are missing. I use the "@angular-builders/custom-webpack" with the Webpack CompressionPlugin. To not have the compressed and uncompressed files in the dist directory, the 'deleteOriginalAssets' property is set to true. If 'deleteOriginalAssets' is set to false, the build is working fine. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Set up a new project with angular cli (no routing, css) `ng new repro-app` 3. Add in package.json in "devDependencies": ``` "@angular-builders/custom-webpack":"^14.0.1", "compression-webpack-plugin":"^10.0.0", ``` 5. Add a new file in root directory called 'extra-webpack.config.js' 6. Write this code into 'extra-webpack.config.js': ``` const CompressionPlugin = require("compression-webpack-plugin"); module.exports = { plugins: [ new CompressionPlugin({ deleteOriginalAssets: true, }) ], }; ``` 7. In angular.json change the builder in build to `@angular-builders/custom-webpack:browser` 8. Add the option in build: ``` "customWebpackConfig": { "path": "./extra-webpack.config.js" }, ``` 9. Run `npm i` 10. Run `npm run build` 11. In the dist directory you will see the zipped files and the index.html with missing scripts tag. (Running npm run build with deleteOriginalAssets set to false, the index.html is fine). ## üî• Exception or Error The script tags in index.html are missing:
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Build not working correctly with CompressionWebpackPlugin and property 'deleteOriginalAssets'" (#23817)

14.2 is the minimum versions that is needed to support workspaces with TypeScript 4.8

Closes #23804

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow esbuild-based builder to use SVG Angular templates
Issues.Body:
The experimental esbuild-based browser application builder will now consider SVG files as
Angular component templates. Previously, only HTML files were considered templates and this
resulted in the esbuild-based builder to try to process the SVG file as a stylesheet.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow esbuild-based builder to use SVG Angular templates" (#23808)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove deprecated usage of `canParse`
Issues.Body: All parsers now implement `parser.analyze`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove deprecated usage of `canParse`" (#23807)

Issues.Title: build: allow no-remote-exec targets to be cached on CI
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: allow no-remote-exec targets to be cached on CI" (#23789)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): reorganize esbuild builder setup steps
Issues.Body:
This contains several minor adjustments to the setup steps for the experimental
esbuild-based browser application builder. It better groups the output directory
deletion and creation steps as well as moves entry point normalization into the
normalize options helper function. This should reduce the size of the main
execution function as well as aid in future profiling of the build phases.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): reorganize esbuild builder setup steps" (#23793)

Issues.Title: Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/ivy/index.js): Error: Maximum call stack size exceeded
Issues.Body:
Reference to bug #23597

The same error happened to me. After trying to solve it, I noticed that it happens when I separate the modules manually. On the contrary, if I build the modules from scratch using CLI, the error does not appear.

However, it is a problem when it comes to scaling or maintaining an application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue " Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/ivy/index.js): Error: Maximum call stack size exceeded" (#23814)

Issues.Title: `@angular/cli@14.2` `ng new` command installing Angular `14.0.0-next.0` packages
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Is this a regression?

Yes, this issue was not present in Angular 14.1.3.

### Description

With Angular `@angular/cli@14.2` when running `ng new [name]` it will install Angular `14.0.0-next.0` packages. See below:

```json
  "dependencies": {
    "@angular/animations": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "@angular/common": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "@angular/compiler": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "@angular/core": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "@angular/forms": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "@angular/router": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "rxjs": "~7.5.0",
    "tslib": "^2.3.0",
    "zone.js": "~0.11.4"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^14.2.0",
    "@angular/cli": "~14.2.0",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "^14.0.0-next.0",
    "@types/jasmine": "~4.0.0",
    "jasmine-core": "~4.3.0",
    "karma": "~6.4.0",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "~3.1.0",
    "karma-coverage": "~2.2.0",
    "karma-jasmine": "~5.1.0",
    "karma-jasmine-html-reporter": "~2.0.0",
    "typescript": "~4.7.2"
  }
```

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

1. Install `@angular/cli@14.2`
2. Run `ng new example`
3. Take note of the `package.json` package versions

N/A

---------------------------------------------------------

Issues.Title: E2E fixes
Issues.Body:
**test: account for module resolution differences**
    
In some cases due to module resolution '@ngtools' might already been under `@angular-devkit/build-angular`.

**test: remove hardcoded worker chunk id**
    
This commit changes how we retrieve the worker chunk Id. Prior to this change we hard coded the value, now we get it by reading the file names on disk.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "E2E fixes" (#23803)

Issues.Title: [Angular 14]: Build is failing
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes. The build suddenly getting failed continously ### Description **Note:** The build machines also build angular with node and npm of lower versions. They are successful. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The Build is getting failed in build machines for docker. ## üî• Exception or Error 

/FS/fslocal/jenkins_home/workspace/DPO-Docker-Build-1015/modules/dpo-ui/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:678
      throw new Error("The service is no longer running" + closeData.reason);
            ^

Error: The service is no longer running: write EPIPE
    at sendResponse (/FS/fslocal/jenkins_home/workspace/DPO-Docker-Build-1015/modules/dpo-ui/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:678:13)
    at handleRequest (/FS/fslocal/jenkins_home/workspace/DPO-Docker-Build-1015/modules/dpo-ui/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:741:7)
    at handleIncomingPacket (/FS/fslocal/jenkins_home/workspace/DPO-Docker-Build-1015/modules/dpo-ui/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:756:7)
    at Socket.readFromStdout (/FS/fslocal/jenkins_home/workspace/DPO-Docker-Build-1015/modules/dpo-ui/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:632:7)
    at Socket.emit (node:events:527:28)
    at addChunk (node:internal/streams/readable:315:12)
    at readableAddChunk (node:internal/streams/readable:289:9)
    at Socket.Readable.push (node:internal/streams/readable:228:10)
    at Pipe.onStreamRead (node:internal/stream_base_commons:190:23)

> Task :modules:dpo-ui:npm_run_build FAILED
## üåç Your Environment 


Angular CLI: 14.0.2                                   
Node: 16.15.1                                         
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Angular 14]: Build is failing" (#23792)

Issues.Title: The problem is caused because setting the  environment variable `NODE_ENV` to `production` causes npm install to ignore dev dependencies.
Issues.Body:
The problem is caused because setting the  environment variable `NODE_ENV` to `production` causes npm install to ignore dev dependencies.

_Originally posted by @alan-agius4 in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/22603#issuecomment-1024519757_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The problem is caused because setting the  environment variable `NODE_ENV` to `production` causes npm install to ignore dev dependencies." (#23791)

Issues.Title: bug(MatVerticalStepper): Can't bind to [animationDuration] in vertical stepper.
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I'm unsure whether this is a bug or documentation error, but there's a whole section on it in the documentation here: https://material.angular.io/components/stepper/overview.  I saw a lot of traffic on the issue on #17130, seems like it was pushed back in march, so I'm not sure why I am having the problem.

I have confirmed that I have ReactiveForms loaded as that seems to be a dependency according to  StackOverflow.  

Error message below:
```
Error: src/app/create-flow/create-flow.component.html:4:49 - error NG8002: Can't bind to 'animationDuration' since it isn't a known property of 'mat-vertical-stepper'.
1. If 'mat-vertical-stepper' is an Angular component and it has 'animationDuration' input, then verify that it is part of this module.
2. If 'mat-vertical-stepper' is a Web Component then add 'CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component to suppress this message.
3. To allow any property add 'NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component.
```

### Reproduction

Copied example from documentation, 
ng serve

### Expected Behavior

Runs as expected.

### Actual Behavior

Fails on build.


### Environment

@angular-devkit/architect       0.1303.9
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.3.9
@angular-devkit/core            13.3.9
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.3.9
@angular/cdk                    13.3.9
@angular/cli                    13.3.9
@angular/fire                   7.4.1
@angular/material               13.3.9
@schematics/angular             13.3.9
rxjs                            7.5.6
typescript                      4.6.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatVerticalStepper): Can't bind to [animationDuration] in vertical stepper." (#25545)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/collections): ConnectableObservable incorrectly inferred as data source
Issues.Body:
The `isDataSource` function determines that something is a data source by checking if it has a `connect` method. The problem is that rxjs has a `ConnectableObservable` which also has a `connect` method and which gets incorrectly identified as a data source.

Fixes #25483.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk/collections): ConnectableObservable incorrectly inferred as data source" (#25526)

Issues.Title: dynamic height bug fix on mat tab group
Issues.Body:
this fixes the issue #25538

[bug(mat-tab-group): dynamic height hides   ##overflow-x](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/25538)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "dynamic height bug fix on mat tab group" (#25539)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-tab-group): dynamic height hides overflow-x
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When I use dynamicHeight with the Mat Tab Group component, the defined CSS class also hides the overflow-x

```
.mat-tab-group-dynamic-height .mat-tab-body-content {
	overflow: hidden;
}
```
It is correct on the mat-tab-body tag but missed on div with the mat-tab-body-content class.
```
.mat-tab-group.mat-tab-group-dynamic-height .mat-tab-body.mat-tab-body-active {
	overflow-y: hidden;
}
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Set a Mat Tab Group to dynamic height
2. have wide content in the tab


### Expected Behavior

The **overflow-x** should not be hidden because of **dynamic height**

### Actual Behavior

**.mat-tab-group-dynamic-height .mat-tab-body-content** definition in the css sets the **overflow-x** to **hidden** 

### Environment

- Angular: 13.3.0
- CDK/Material: 13.3.0
- Browser(s): Chrome, Safari
- Operating System: Windows, macOS, iOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-tab-group): dynamic height hides overflow-x" (#25538)
